intro: Ouratea cameronii, commonly known as Cameron's ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
